channel.title: Webclient Resized?
channel.description:
Hey, well basically i am working on a project that will include me remaking maps, making the world size alot smaller and adding alot of new bosses, items, ect.. I am currently getting the basics set up before I go into the extreme stuff.. So i started by resizing the client and managed to get it 1000x600, LOOKS AWESOME. This works perfectly through run.bat, but when i sign the jars on the webclient and host it online, I simply get the same size client with the old background sprite and no login buttons as i have replaced them somewhere else on the client. I changed the size in the HTML file and now i have a 1000x600 white square and when it loads the "loading please wait" is in the old place in the center of where the old sized client would be even though this all works perfectly running from the original files.... As i am writing this i am finding it hard to explain so heres a puu.sh like xD
When loading the applet: [img]http://puu.sh/10q30[/img]
Loading client: [img]http://puu.sh/10qaq[/img]
Loaded: [img]http://puu.sh/10q5H[/img]
Oh forgot to add, this is what it looks like when i run it through run.bat: [img]http://puu.sh/10qlt[/img]
Also, I REALLY need a 3d map editor! if anyone has one... PLEASE share it :)

item.title: Webclient Resized?
item.dc:creator: @nacional nacional
item.description:
@nacional wrote:

thanks for the responses, weeks back I used the 2d one and it takes hours to do anything right.

edit: seems like the site is no longer hosting the file. Anyone have a copy?

item.title: Webclient Resized?
item.dc:creator: @god_0wnz god 0wnz
item.description:
@god_0wnz wrote:

thanks for reply, the file is actually called “GameWindow.java” I have made huge progress on bugs in my client today, everything seems to work except one little thing i cant seem to figgure out… Basically when you click “chat history”, if you have only just logged on and there is no history, it starts the text at the top of the box then once it fills up it then adds the scroll bar where as it is suppose to start at the bottom then do the same thing, either way its fine

IN NEED OF A 3D MAP EDITOR! BADLY!

Read full topic

item.title: Webclient Resized?
item.dc:creator: @management management
item.description:
@management wrote:

I believe you need to look in the GameApplet class
